channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Previous recent bodge repair already failed, 25th February
item.description:
The recent bodge that was done on these huge pot holes have already failed. There's huge pothole people are having to avoid.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albert Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The missing broken fence and large trees still remain and no one attends to the green area on Keriston Avenue, 25th February
item.description:
Thank you for attending to the overhanging trees along this footpath on the A40 side but unfortunately there is still the issue of the trees overhanging gardens, and dangerously against private fencing. There is also the issue of the broken fencing previously reported and also the lack of maintenance and care on the green area that backs onto this footpath that is used as a quick cut through bringing mud and dog faeces onto Keriston Avenue. Can both of these issues be attended too as a matter of urgency.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Keriston Avenue, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: I do not think the sequencing has been correctly reset following the reopening of the A40.Traffic coming in is being held incorrectly which is backing up past Greville house. Those is the know are strarting to reuse the East End Rat run ,which frankly we residents have had enought of! Could you please investigate and rectify before another Artic gets stuck by the Merryfellow Inn? Thanks, 25th February
item.description:

item.title: Litter between Jct 5 and 10 on M5 in both directions., 25th February
item.description:
Lots of litter on Jct 10 sliproad and all along verges and central reservation to Jct 5. Mostly small items but also larger items including plastic sheeting, car debris (tyres, a bumper) and discarded traffic cones.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M5, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: MASSIVE potholes, 25th February
item.description:
There are a large number of deep potholes all across this area. They are constantly being filled and simply reappear again within a week!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Mill Lane, Brockworth, Gloucester

item.title: Poor road condition and pot holes on roundabout, 25th February
item.description:
Logged already 1st February. There are potholes around the roundabout which to be honest the whole area the roundabout radius needs to be properly assessed and sorted. I'm pretty sure a drain on the inside of roundabout in middle also is sticking up or has pothole forming too.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crosshands Roundabout, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocking of footpath with no alternative, 25th February
item.description:
Damaged wall of house has safety barriers in place, but these completely block the footpath, causing pedestrians to briefly move onto the road, where the speed limit is 50 MPH. There is no footpath immediately on the other side of the road that could be used instead. Wall needs to be repaired in order for the path to be made clear.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shurdington Road, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
